conclusion: Determine the amount of charge Q on the capacitor and identify which plate (M or N) is positively charged.
The two metal rods rotate uniformly with an angular velocity Ï‰ = 600 rad/s.
The induced EMF in one rod is calculated using Faraday's law of induction as 12 V.
The total EMF across the ring is 24 V.
The total resistance of the circuit consists of the two rods and the external resistance R of the rod ab.
The total resistance R_total is simplified to R_eff = R for calculation.
The current I through the circuit is calculated as 240 A.
The charge Q on the capacitor is calculated as 2.16 C.
The direction of the induced EMF determines the polarity of the capacitor plates.
Plate M is determined to be positively charged.
The final answer is that the charge Q on the capacitor is 2.16 C and plate M is positively charged.
